item.title: On blogging with R
item.description: As noted previously, I use R for school and work when doing statistical computing. I tend to prefer sharing nicely formatted HTMLs generated from analyses conducted in R using R Markdown. I was excited to learn that it was now possible to integrate “knitted” HTML output from an R Markdown (.Rmd) file to my Hugo blog with the assistance of the new R package, blogdown. Quick start blogdown states that the “main [blog platform] we support in blogdown is Hugo”.

item.title: On my favourite R packages
item.description: R is the statistical programming language I have used for a number of years in school and work. One reason I have enjoyed using R (particularly over SAS, but comparably to Python) is the large number of packages available for download to enhance the scope of analyses. There are a number of packages I always load when starting an analysis: Everything in the tidyverse: the tidyverse includes packages that simplify data manipulation, data cleaning, data summarisation, and graphical representation of data.

item.title: On starting a blog
item.description: I spent a weekend building this static website that could host simple markdown documents or HTML outputs.
